name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokemon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokemon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

strengths: Unlimited use of Damage Swap per turn enables flexible damage management
Can keep powerful attackers in play longer by moving damage away
Excellent synergy with high-HP Pokemon like Chansey
Works well with healing cards like Pokemon Center
weaknesses: High retreat cost of 3 makes it vulnerable when active
80 HP is relatively low for a Stage 2
Psychic weakness means mirror matches are dangerous
Requires full evolution line to set up (3 cards)
Pokemon Power disabled by status conditions
counters: Mewtwo - Psychic weakness and high damage output
Energy Removal - Slows down energy attachment for retreat/attack
Gust of Wind - Can force Alakazam active and trap it

competitiveHistory: Alakazam was a cornerstone of competitive play in the original Base Set era. The 'Alakazam/Chansey' deck archetype was one of the most powerful control strategies, using Damage Swap to manage damage while Chansey absorbed hits. This combination was so effective it influenced the meta significantly.

rulings.ruling: Damage Swap can be used multiple times per turn, moving one counter at a time.
You cannot use Damage Swap to Knock Out your own Pokemon.
Damage Swap cannot be used if Alakazam is affected by Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
